questions.question_text:
A marketing team wants to create an automation that can take a population, evaluate its subscriber data, and send a series of emails. The emails received may vary based on each subscriber's engagement with previous emails in the automation.
Which tool should a team with no SQL knowledge or support use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Option D: Journey Builder is the recommended choice because it provides a visual, drag-and-drop interface that allows non-technical marketers to design and automate customer journeys with personalized, dynamic interactions. With Journey Builder, you can easily create a series of emails, decision splits, and wait times based on subscriber behavior without the need for SQL knowledge. It offers more flexibility and customization options compared to Predictive Email, making it suitable for the described scenario.

Selected Answer: D
Journey Builder - SQL Not needed/ Can evaluate data using Einstein features / Can send series of emails

questions.question_text:
The marketing team at a bank needs to receive a file of all subscribers who were sent payment reminder emails and opened them each week. The file needs to be encrypted and placed on the bank's external SFTP.
How should the scheduled automation be configured to achieve this?

discussion.content:
C. SQL Query Activity > Data Extract Activity > File Transfer Activity
 step 1) SQL Query Activity would be used to create a query to select the relevant subscribers.
step 2)The resulting data is then extracted using a Data Extract Activity.
step 3) the extracted file is transferred to the bank's external SFTP using a File Transfer Activity.

choices.D: Data Extract Activity > SQL Query Activity > File Transfer Activity
choices.C: SQL Query Activity > Data Extract Activity > File Transfer Activity
choices.B: Filter Activity > SQL Query Activity > File Transfer Activity
choices.A: Filter Activity > File Transfer Activity > Data Extract Activity
